original_data.question: A 52-year-old man with a history of gastric cancer that was treated with subtotal gastrectomy dies in a motor vehicle collision. At autopsy, examination of the spinal cord shows unilateral atrophy of the neurons in the area indicated by the arrow. Neurological examination of the patient when he was still alive would most likely have shown which of the following findings?

options.A: Decreased sense of temperature in the ipsilateral arm
options.B: Decreased strength of the contralateral leg
options.C: Decreased vibratory sense in the ipsilateral arm
options.D: Decreased positional sense in the ipsilateral leg

model_response:
The arrow points to the base of the spinal cord, where the posterior column lies. The neurons indicated are those that would have been atrophied in this patient. These neurons are part of the fasciculus gracilis and fasciculus cuneatus, which carry the sensations of vibration, position, and fine touch. These fibers ascend ipsilaterally, so atrophy on one side will lead to loss of vibration and position sense on the ipsilateral (same side) of the body. The other choices are carried by the spinothalamic tract, which carries crude touch and pain sensations and crosses to the contralateral side of the spinal cord, so atrophy on one side will not lead to loss of these sensations on the ipsilateral side of the body.

Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human males as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Record and study of past events.
A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the stomach.
Surgical removal of part of the stomach.

Accidents on streets, roads, and highways involving drivers, passengers, pedestrians, or vehicles. Traffic accidents refer to AUTOMOBILES (passenger cars, buses, and trucks), BICYCLING, and MOTORCYCLES but not OFF-ROAD MOTOR VEHICLES; RAILROADS nor snowmobiles.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
A cylindrical column of tissue that lies within the vertebral canal. It is composed of WHITE MATTER and GRAY MATTER.
Involving only one part or side.
Decrease in the size of a cell, tissue, organ, or multiple organs, associated with a variety of pathological conditions such as abnormal cellular changes, ischemia, malnutrition, or hormonal changes.
The basic cellular units of nervous tissue. Each neuron consists of a body, an axon, and dendrites. Their purpose is to receive, conduct, and transmit impulses in the NERVOUS SYSTEM.

The continents and countries situated on those continents; the UNITED STATES and each of the constituent states arranged by region; CANADA and each of its provinces; AUSTRALIA and each of its states; the major bodies of water and major islands on both hemispheres; and selected major cities.
Assessment of sensory and motor responses and reflexes that is used to determine impairment of the nervous system.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
